name: Codenplay
body:
Everything started with a crazy idea...

> WouldnÂ´t be great to have a low-cost, easy-to-program , C/C++ , RPi based, handle videogame console?

Wow... Are you crazy? ...But, how about using [Biicode](https://www.biicode.com/), and its new RPi support? How about creating a RPi shield that will "support" the videogame console, and a library, that will include everything you need to program your videogames, in a new fashion way? Ok..

### Let's do it!! 
(there is also a [contest](https://www.biicode.com/biicontest2014-en), so, let's try that deadline as well)

(Yes, WE LOVE deadlines. Yes, WE LOVE lack of sleep following crazy ideas. And YES!, WE LOVE videogames)   

This is going to be long so, please, take your time...

### The Hardware
> Keep it simple, and dirty, for the first prototype.

What do we need:

1. Small screen, analog input. 
2. Joystick and buttons.
3. Power, a lot of power. 

(To be bought from the same store, if possible)

So, here is our selected hardware:

Screen: [Adafruit 3.5" TFT PAL/NTSC](http://www.bricogeek.com/shop/pantallas-lcd/574-pantalla-tft-35-ntsc-pal.html)

Joystick: [Sparkfun Joystick](http://www.bricogeek.com/shop/componentes/240-joystick-analogico-playstation2.html)

Buttons: [Square buttons](http://www.bricogeek.com/shop/508-pack-pulsadores-de-colores-15-unidades.html)

Battery: [LiPo 1S 6000 mAh battery](http://www.bricogeek.com/shop/baterias-lipo/418-bateria-lipo-6000mah-37v.html)

Battery charger and regulators (5V for the RPi, 12V for the Screen): 

[Sparkfun LiPo USB charger](http://www.bricogeek.com/shop/baterias-lipo/48-cargador-de-bateria-lipo-
usb.html)

[Pololu adjustable regulator](http://www.bricogeek.com/shop/herramientas-de-prototipado/184-conversor-dc-ajustable-4-25v-2a.html)

One GPIO expander and one analog to digital converter, for the buttons and joystick.
